Live album info
AMG wrote:
Disk 1 Review by Stuart Kremsky
This 1985 issue, a co-production of Ulysse Musique, France, and East Coasting Records, New York, was issued "with the kind permission of Jazz Workshop, Inc. and Susan Graham Mingus," making this one of the few legitimate releases from the 1964 European tour. The sound leaves something to be desired in terms of clarity and the mix. Still, this was one of Mingus's best bands, and this is one of the few opportunities to hear the group with Johnny Coles (he collapsed on stage in Paris eight days after this show). Jaki Byard is nicely displayed on this set; the horns, though, sound like they were off-mike most of the time. This is another valuable example of a Mingus band in its natural setting -- on stage, performing.

Disk 2 Review by Scott Yanow
The second of two CDs taken from an Amsterdam concert features Charles Mingus's remarkable 1964 sextet (which included Eric Dolphy, Clifford Jordan, Jaki Byard and Johnny Coles) on a half-hour version of "Fables of Faubus," a nearly 23-minute rendition of "Meditation on a Pair of Wire Cutters" and a more concise bass feature on "Sophisticated Lady." The music is quite explorative, episodic, unpredictable and exciting.

Disk 1

1. Ow! (Dedicated to a Genious [sic]) - 21:25
2. So Long Eric (Don't Stay Over There Too Long Eric) - 22:21
3. A.T.F.W. U.S.A. (A.T.F.W. Y.O.U.) - 4:52
4. Orange Was the Color of Her Dress Then Blue Silk - 13:55

Disk 2

1. Meditation on a Pair of Wire Cutters - 23:09
2. Sophisticated Lady - 5:39
3. Fables of Faubas [sic] (part 1) - 23:16
4. Fables of Faubas [sic] (part 2) - 7:14
